Content:: One-day races and Classics Taco van der Hoorn (born 4 December 1993) is a Dutch cyclist who currently rides for UCI WorldTeam Intermarché–Wanty–Gobert Matériaux.[5] For the 2021 season, van der Hoorn initially announced a contract with the BEAT Cycling,[6] but the following month, he signed a deal with the Intermarché–Wanty–Gobert Matériaux team.[5] He won stage 3 of the 2021 Giro d'Italia, during his first Grand Tour. This biographical article related to a Dutch cycling person born in the 1990s is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
